Welcome to pqreader’s documentation!¶

Created on Mon Sep 9 17:08:31 2019

@author: Martin Fränzl

pqreader.correct_overflow(timetags, valid)[source]¶

Correct time-tags for overflow.

Arguments:

timetags (int32 array): time-tags

valid (int32 array): valid flags

pqreader.process_t3records(t3records)[source]¶

Decode 32 bit T3R records from PicoQuant .t3r files.

Arguments:
t3records (int32 array): T3R records
Returns:

route (int32 array): The routing channel the photon event came from.

data (int32 array): The channel number of the photon event (start-stop-timing).

timetags (int64 array): The time-tag of the photon event.

pqreader.t3r_reader(filename)[source]¶

Read processed TR3 records from a PicoQuant .t3r file.

Arguments:
filename (string): The path of the .t3r file to be read.
Returns:

timetags (int64 array): The time-tag of the photon event.

route (int32 array): The routing channel the photon event came from.

data (int32 array): The channel number of the photon event (start-stop-timing).

metadata (dict): A dictionary containing the metadata.

pqreader.t3r_records(filename)[source]¶

Read the raw T3 records and metadata from a PicoQuant .t3r file.

Arguments:
filename (string): The path of the .t3r file to be read.
Returns:

timetags (int32 array): The raw T3R record from the T3R file.

metadata (dict): A dictionary containing the metadata.

pqreader.thd_reader(filename)[source]¶

Read data from a PicoQuant .thd file.

Arguments:
filename (string): The path of the .thd file to be read.
Returns:

hist (int32 array): The historgram data.

bins (int32 array): The time bins.

metadata (dict): A dictionary containing the metadata.
